intro: Horkelia sericoleuca, commonly known as the silverleaf horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Horkelia sericoleuca is adapted to arid environments and is considered a low-growing perennial species.
